meanings.definition: A person who habitually sees or anticipates the worst in a situation.
meanings.sent1: My friend is such a gloomsters, always expecting the worst.
meanings.sent2: The gloomsters in the office never believe anything will go well.
meanings.sent3: The gloomsters at the party thought the balloons would pop any minute.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a gathering of gloomsters, each one predicting doom.
meanings.sent5: The gloomsters painted a dark picture of the future, clouding everyone's mood.

meanings.definition: A group of individuals who consistently express pessimistic views or predictions.
meanings.sent1: The gloomsters gathered in the corner, murmuring about the upcoming project.
meanings.sent2: Whenever there's bad news, the gloomsters are the first to spread it.
meanings.sent3: The gloomsters' book club only reads tragic endings.
meanings.sent4: The gloomsters' cloud of negativity followed them wherever they went.
meanings.sent5: The gloomsters' meeting was like a storm of pessimism, raining on everyone's parade.
